channel.title: Autocolor
channel.description: Im am attempting to make an autocolor for an autofighter. Can anyone offer any assistance on how to attempt this?

item.title: Autocolor
item.dc:creator: @Infintry001 Infintry001
item.description:
@Infintry001 wrote:

this is how i did it…

[scar]//Based on Kane’s procedure in SRL\
Procedure RandomScan(xs,ys,xe,ye : integer);
var x,y : integer;
begin
x := max(xs, xe) - min(xs, xe);
y := max(ys, ye) - min(ys, ye);
x := random(x);
y := random(y);
MMouse(xs + x, ys + y, 0, 0);
GetMousePos(RSX,RSY);
end;

function MonsterScan(var MonsterCol : integer; MonsterName : string):Boolean;
var mx,my,counter : integer;
begin
repeat
RandomScan(3,3,515,336);
if(IsUpText(‘ttack’))then
begin
MonsterCol := GetColor(RSX,RSY);
result := true;
end;
counter := counter + 1;
until(result=true)
if(not(LoggedIn) or (counter=20))then
begin
Result := false;
Exit;
end;
end;[/scar]

Think its too detectable and awkward?

Read full topic

item.title: Autocolor
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

Heres how I’ve seen it done, though I could be very off as I can barely think straight right now.

Place somewhere in your script a variable of the general color of the monster/npc, then have teh script find that with a tolerance, take the color that is at the mouse position and save it, then move right 1 or 2 x coords and save that color, etc.

Then to find the colors have it search for color1 or color 2 etc until it is found.

This could be problematic with a fighter though because the npc might move, giving you the color of dirt, so you will probably have to check the difference of the colors.

Sorry I started rambling

Read full topic
